dialogue.introduction: I'm Shoukaku, the first of the Shoukaku-class carriers. I will try my best with Zuikaku to try and live up to the names of my seniors in the first and second aviation divisions.
dialogue.library_intro: I'm Shoukaku, the first ship in the Shoukaku carrier series. I was designed and built as the first purpose-built large regular carrier to serve after the Washington Treaty was renounced. With my sister Zuikaku, we make the fifth carrier division. Following the tragedy, we followed in the footsteps of our seniors and continued to support the front lines. I'm Shoukaku, the first ship in the Shoukaku carrier series. I was designed and built as the first purpose-built large regular carrier to serve after the Washington Treaty was renounced. With my sister Zuikaku, we make the fifth carrier division. Following the tragedy, we followed in the footsteps of our seniors and continued to support the front lines. And now, having gotten over Mariana, I wish to continue taking a leap forward with the Admiral.
dialogue.secretary1: Geez, Zuikaku, stop fiddling with my skirt so mu- huh, oh my, Admiral?
dialogue.secretary2: Zuikaku, don't bother the admiral so much, okay?
dialogue.secretaryidle: Admiral? Um... We should head to Port Moresby... Um, uh...
dialogue.secretarymarried: Admiral, I'm always really grateful for you hard work. Please take a short break, okay.
dialogue.wedding: Thank you, Admiral. Giving me these planes that I've never seen before, my gratitude is overflowing. Maybe… just maybe… if my wish comes true, after the Marianas, we can stay together…
dialogue.show_players_score: Admiral, would you like to browse through the report?
dialogue.equipment1: Thank you! I can use these!
dialogue.equipment2: I'm so happy! Many thanks, admiral.
dialogue.docking_minor_damage: I'll take a short bath... be out in a bit.
dialogue.docking_moderate_damage: I seem to get injured rather easily... is this so, Zuikaku?
dialogue.docking_complete: Admiral, ship in the dock was fully repaired.
dialogue.ship_construction: Admiral, a new ship has been completed.
dialogue.return_from_sortie: The fleet has returned! Thank you all for the hard work.
dialogue.start_a_sortie: You ready, Zuikaku? Let's go. Mobile squad, deploying!
dialogue.air_battle: Support team, cover the assault squad!
dialogue.attack: Here I go. All planes, attack!
dialogue.night_battle: Now... what's going to appear? Make sure you watch out for submarines.
dialogue.mvp: I did it, Admiral! It's all thanks to the planes and supporting ships! Thank you all!
dialogue.minor_damaged1: O-ouch... I can still do this!
dialogue.minor_damaged2: Geez, why is it always me?
dialogue.moderately_damaged: I've been hit! It's difficult to launch and land ship-borne planes!
dialogue.sunk: Looks like... I'm gone again... Yahagi, Akizuki... please take care of things now.
dialogue.second_anniversary_2015: 2nd year anniversary... I too, am incredibly happy about this. Zuikaku? Zuikaku? Oh my, Zuikaku? You aren't around?
dialogue.rainy_season_2015: It is the rainy season. Reminds me the days of the MO strategy. And a squall too, at that time... right, Zuikaku?
dialogue.early_summer_2015: Zuikaku, did you buy a new swimsuit? My, it is nice. It's very cute. Eh? Me? I'm fine with last year's. Wha, really? Do you think so?
dialogue.fall_2015: Autumn. That's right, Zuikaku. Autumn makes you feel a bit lonely, doesn't it? No, it's okay. I'm fine now.
dialogue.christmas_2015: What's the matter, Zuikaku? What's with the annoyed face? It's Christmas time, have some of this and relax, okay? Eh, Ehhh~!?
dialogue.end_of_year_2015: December is a busy month. Zuikaku, that cloth is for the tablewares. Ah, that's not it, it's this one... huh? Aah! Oww... Ah, oh dear!!
dialogue.new_year_2016: Admiral, A happy new year to you! I hope this year you will take care of me and my sister, Zuikaku as well.
dialogue.setsubun_2016: Zuikaku, It's Setsubun. ....No, don't worry. Just leave the demon role to me. I'm used to it already...

hourly.0000: Admiral? Seems like the date has changed.
hourly.0500: It's now 0500. The sun's about to come up, huh.
hourly.0600: 0600. It's about wake-up time for everyone.
hourly.0700: 0700. What would you like for breakfast?
hourly.0800: 0800. I'll do my best today too.
hourly.0900: It's now 0900. Should I send out scout planes?
hourly.1000: It's 1000. I wonder if Zuikaku is okay?
hourly.1100: 1100. I guess we should prepare for lunch.
hourly.1200: Admiral, it's 1200. Shall we have lunch?
hourly.1400: It's 1400. Admiral, are you feeling tired?
hourly.1500: It's 1500. The campaign is about to begin.
hourly.1600: 1600. I'll be sending up the CAP.
hourly.1700: It's 1700. Isn't the sunset beautiful, Admiral?
hourly.2000: 2000. There are some noisy light cruisers. I wonder why?
hourly.2300: It's now 2300. You really should be resting now shouldn't you?
